pr_title: Refactors Cassandra queries so they are cheaper and easier to migrate

timeline.message:
Refactors Cassandra queries so they are cheaper and easier to migrate

Before, we used labels a lot, and generally a lot of query builder code.
This switches most to positional syntax, which is cheaper and easier to
migrate to cassandra driver 4.

This also reformats everything to make the migration feel like less
change.

Finally, this consolidates as much code as possible, notably repetitive
inserts and queries, again to reduce the heft needed to upgrade later.

timeline.bodyText: you'll notice constants like this around. we had assigned them via variables before, this is just a bit more obvious.
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText: both of these complicated sharing and testing for things that were constant in practice. The timestamp codec has not difference based on version, and bucketCount was always set to 10 with no means to override it ever. since this is a legacy codebase I think being more obvious about constants is better than looking as if we had really parameterized them.
